title: Do We Choose Our Beliefs? Is the word "belief" sufficient?
description:
JBP famously won't say "I believe in God" because he doesn't want to hazard misunderstandings on "belief" or "God". He says that the way in which people act out their beliefs is more important than what they say. He isn't alone in this Jesus said similar things. Many religious traditions say similar things. Is the word "belief" really sufficient for this conversation? Is it helpful? 

Peter Boghossian "Choosing Beliefs" Letter 1 https://letter.wiki/conversation/22
Vervaeke Meaning Crisis 13 https://youtu.be/vGB8k7jk1AQ
Keller Preaching to the Heart https://youtu.be/SWe1E8AMMr8
JBP April 2019 Q/A https://youtu.be/rgivGzjZixM

For the audio podcast mirror on Podbean http://paulvanderklay.podbean.com/

To listen to this on ITunes https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/paul-vanderklays-podcast/id1394314333 

If you need the RSS feed for your podcast player https://paulvanderklay.podbean.com/feed/
